title: Apply Emergency Tourniquet
brief: Use a tourniquet as last resort when other bleeding control methods fail.
steps: Step 1: Only use when direct pressure and all other methods have failed to control bleeding.
Step 2: Place tourniquet 5-10 centimeters above wound site, between wound and heart.
Step 3: Never place directly over the wound or a fracture.
Step 4: Use a stick as handle to tighten the tourniquet.
Step 5: Tighten only enough to stop blood flow - no more.
Step 6: Bind the free end of stick to limb to prevent unwinding.
Step 7: Clean and bandage the wound after securing tourniquet.
Step 8: If alone, do not remove tourniquet.
Step 9: With a buddy, release pressure every 10-15 minutes for 1-2 minutes to allow blood flow.
warnings: Leaving tourniquet too long can cause gangrene and limb loss.
Improper application can cause permanent nerve and tissue damage.
Use only as absolute last resort when victim will die without it.
